name: Texas Windstorm Insurance Association
description: The Texas Windstorm Insurance Association (TWIA) is a state-mandated, non-profit entity that provides wind and hail insurance coverage for residential and commercial properties in designated catastrophe areas along the Texas coast. Established in the wake of the insurance market disruptions caused by hurricanes, TWIA ensures that property owners can obtain necessary coverage against windstorm and hail damage when private insurers are unwilling or unable to provide such policies. The association plays a crucial role in safeguarding the financial interests of coastal residents and businesses, helping to stabilize the insurance market in Texas. TWIA operates under the oversight of the Texas Department of Insurance and is funded through premiums, assessments, and reinsurance arrangements. The organization also engages in comprehensive risk management strategies, including community outreach to educate policyholders about windstorm risks and insurance options. By pooling the risks associated with windstorm damage, TWIA is able to provide coverage to thousands of policyholders while promoting resilience in Texas's coastal communities. As climate change continues to impact weather patterns, TWIA remains committed to adapting its services and products to meet the evolving needs of its policyholders.
